result.execSummary:
The defendant John P Ryan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. - stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, domestic abuse and DNA surcharges. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Submit DNA sample.
No contact with Judy Ryan except for court appearances in divorce proceedings.
Attend and complete the Domestic Abuse Alternative Program.  
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Comply with any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.   
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

records.addlTxt: Portage County DNA Proof of Submission
from D. Lane

10:00 a.m. Defendant John P. Ryan in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Plea to Count 1 w/conditions stated. Count 2 to be DRI.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 1 No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Victim was given notification.
BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Count 2 is dismissed read in.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson concurs with joint recommendation in part, but requests no conditional jail.  1 day credit

BY THE COURT: *****PROBTION***
I/S Sentence:  250 days Jail w/huber if approved by jail administration - 1 day credit  - stayed
24  months Probation
Conditions:
100 hours Community service
 Submit DNA sample.
No contact with Judy Ryan except for court appearances in divorce proceedings.
Pay costs, domestic & DNA surcharge.
Maintain fulltime employment. 
Attend and complete the Domestic Abuse Alternative Program.  
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Comply with any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.   
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-30-2015 10:00 am
Defendant Record Update
Pre-trial conference at 09-28-2015 09:30 am

Defendant John P. Ryan in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
3:13 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond is continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
